message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the use of non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) in visible light communication (VLC), which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT) and communication (cs.COMM). The paper also considers the nonlinear characteristics of a light emitting diode (LED) and proposes a pre-distorter for compensation, which falls under the category of networked and distributed systems (cs.NI) and systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper proposes a power allocation strategy and derives analytical upper bounds for the bit error rate, which are topics related to machine learning (cs.LG).
